hero.h1: Backflow Prevention in Sorrento, FL
hero.subheadline: Prevent backflow contamination in your Sorrento, FL home.
hero.body: Backflow contamination can occur when your home's water pressure drops, allowing sewage to flow back into your pipes. This can lead to serious health risks and costly repairs. Our experts can install backflow prevention devices to protect your family and property.

what_is_section.body: Backflow prevention devices are installed at the point of connection between your home's plumbing and the municipal water supply. This ensures that contaminated water cannot flow back into your pipes. Our team uses high-quality devices that meet local regulations and codes. In Sorrento, FL, backflow prevention is crucial due to the high water table and porous soil, which can cause pipes to settle and shift. DIY backflow prevention is not recommended, as it can lead to costly mistakes and even more serious health risks.

why_city_needs_section.body: Sorrento, FL, is particularly prone to backflow contamination due to its location near Lake County's waterways and the high water table. In neighborhoods like Mount Plymouth and Mount Dora, backflow prevention is essential to protect homes built in the 1950s and 60s, which often have older plumbing systems. The sandy, porous soil in these areas can cause pipes to shift and settle, increasing the risk of backflow. Additionally, the limestone aquifer that supplies water to central and south Florida can lead to hard water, which can also contribute to backflow issues.
